00042 /* Supported file formats: */
00043 typedef enum FMB_IO_format_t {
00044   FMB_ASCII_format /* default */, 
00045   FMB_ASCII_human_format /*like 'FMB_ASCII_format' but "human readable",
00046                           * only for 'output_format' (not for 'input_format') */,  
00047   FMB_binary_format, 
00048   NEMO_format
00049 } FMB_IO_format_t;
00050 #define FMB_IO_FORMAT_PRINTF_TEST(x) ((x) == FMB_ASCII_format ? "FMB_ASCII_format" :                    \
00051                                       ((x) == FMB_ASCII_human_format ? "FMB_ASCII_human_format" :       \
00052                                        ((x) == FMB_binary_format ? "FMB_binary_format" :                \
00053                                         "NEMO_format")))
00054 
00055 /* FMB binary format: 
00056  * - the first 4 bytes (i.e. 2 'unsigned long long') are the followings: 
00057  *   - the first 2 bytes are used as a "magic number" to check that the file corresponds to "FMB binary" format
00058  *   - the following 2 bytes are the "FMB binary format header" and contain additional informations 
00059  *     about the data types (float or double) and about which data are present in the file 
00060  *     (position, value, potential, force, speed vector) 
00061  * 
00062  * - the rest of the file contains, for each body, in this order:
00063  *     position (x,y,z)           (mandatory) 
00064  *     value                      (mandatory)
00065  *     potential                  (optional)
00066  *     force vector (x,y,z)       (optional) 
00067  *     speed vector (x,y,z)       (optional)
00068  *  
00069  * We use htonl/ntohl (as well as htonf/ntohf and htond/ntohd) functions for portability.
00070  */
00071 #define FMB_BINARY_FORMAT_MAGIC_NUMBER                      0x77777777UL /* 2 bytes */
00072 #define FMB_BINARY_FORMAT_HEADER_FLOAT_DATA_BIT             0x1UL 
00073 #define FMB_BINARY_FORMAT_HEADER_POSITION_PRESENCE_BIT      0x2UL 
00074 #define FMB_BINARY_FORMAT_HEADER_VALUE_PRESENCE_BIT         0x4UL 
00075 #define FMB_BINARY_FORMAT_HEADER_POTENTIAL_PRESENCE_BIT     0x8UL 
00076 #define FMB_BINARY_FORMAT_HEADER_FORCE_PRESENCE_BIT         0x10UL 
00077 #define FMB_BINARY_FORMAT_HEADER_SPEED_PRESENCE_BIT         0x20UL 
00078 #define FMB_BINARY_FORMAT_HEADER_IS_THE_BIT_SET(info, bit)  ((info) & (bit)) /* 'info' is an 'unsigned long' */
00079 
00080 /* NEMO format: */
00081 #define NEMO_SUFFIX_LENGTH (sizeof(".nemo")) /* ok for ".NEMO" also */ 
00082 
00083 typedef struct FMB_IO_Info_t {
00084 
00085   /*** 'info_display_level': ***/
00086   /* 0 : no information displayed
00087    * 1 : essential information displayed (i.e. no display of data, but display of the main steps, CPU times) 
00088    * 2 : more information displayed (octree structure, info about parallelism : these information cost CPU time to be displayed)
00089    * 3 : maximum information displayed */
00090   int info_display_level;
00091 
00092   /* input/output filenames: */
00093   char *input_data_filename;
00094   char *output_data_filename;
00095 
00096   /* input/output file formats: */
00097   FMB_IO_format_t input_format;
00098   FMB_IO_format_t output_format;
00099   bool input_format_from_cmd_line;
00100   bool output_format_from_cmd_line;
00101   
00102   /* input/output streams: */
00103   FILE *f_input_data;
00104   FILE *f_output_data;
00105 
00106   /* input/output streams: */
00107   bool input_data_currently_used;
00108   bool output_data_currently_used;
00109 
00110   /* data files compression: */
00111   bool are_input_data_bzipped2; 
00112   bool are_output_data_bzipped2; 
00113   bool are_input_data_gzipped; 
00114   bool are_output_data_gzipped; 
00115 
00116   /* input/output streams for gzipped files: */
00117   gzFile f_input_gz_data;
00118   gzFile f_output_gz_data;
00119 
00120   /* buffer for gzipped file reading: */
00121   char *gz_input_buf;
00122   long gz_input_buf_len;
00123 
00124   /* input/output secondary/tertiary streams for NEMO format: */
00125   FILE *f_input_data2;
00126   FILE *f_input_data3;
00127   FILE *f_output_data2;
00128   FILE *f_output_data3;
00129   bool use_PhaseSpace_in_input; /* if TRUE: we use 'PhaseSpace', 
00130                                  * otherwise, we use 'Position' and 'Velocity'  
00131                                  * (only for NEMO format) */
00132   bool use_PhaseSpace_in_output; /* same as 'use_PhaseSpace_in_output' but for writing */
00133   bool is_Velocity_present_in_input; /* only for NEMO format */
00134   bool is_Velocity_present_in_output; /* only for NEMO format */
00135   bool is_input_coord_float; /* if TRUE: we use 'float' (single precision) for 'PhaseSpace' (or 'Position' and 'Velocity), 
00136                               * otherwise, we use 'double' (double precision)   
00137                               * (only for NEMO format) */
00138   bool is_output_coord_float; /* same as 'is_input_coord_float' but for writing */
00139   FILE *f_input_data_forces;
00140 
00141   /* for FMB binary format: */
00142   unsigned long FMB_binary_format_header;
00143   
00144 
00145   /* with/without decomposed data files: */
00146   bool dump_proc_decomposition;
00147   bool use_decomposed_data_files; 
00148   bool proc_decomposition_with_empty_or_not; /* If FALSE we use "with_nb_particles". 
00149                                               * Default is: "with_nb_particles". */
00150 
00151 } FMB_IO_Info_t;

00178 /* If there is bug for gzgets with huge gzipped files, see inflate()/deflate() and
00179  * FAQ of zlib-1.2.3 => question #32: "Can zlib work with greater than 4 GB of data?" ... */

00183 /* 'nb_chars_to_read' should include the terminating NULL chararacter ('\0'). */
00184 #define FMB_IO_FSCANF(nb_chars_to_read, fscanf_format, ...) {                                                   \
00185   if (FMB_IO_Info.are_input_data_gzipped){                                                                      \
00186     if (FMB_IO_Info.gz_input_buf_len < nb_chars_to_read){                                                       \
00187       FMB_IO_Info.gz_input_buf = FMB_realloc_with_check(FMB_IO_Info.gz_input_buf, nb_chars_to_read);            \
00188       FMB_IO_Info.gz_input_buf_len = nb_chars_to_read;                                                          \
00189     }                                                                                                           \
00190     if (gzgets(FMB_IO_Info.f_input_gz_data, FMB_IO_Info.gz_input_buf, nb_chars_to_read) == Z_NULL){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF(); }                \
00191     sscanf(FMB_IO_Info.gz_input_buf, fscanf_format, __VA_ARGS__);                                               \
00192   }                                                                                                             \
00193   else {                                                                                                        \
00194     if (fscanf(FMB_IO_Info.f_input_data, fscanf_format, __VA_ARGS__) == 0){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF(); }                \
00195   }                                                                                                             \
00196 }
00197 
00198 #define FMB_IO_FPRINTF(...) {                                                           \
00199   if (FMB_IO_Info.are_output_data_gzipped){                                             \
00200     gzprintf(FMB_IO_Info.f_output_gz_data, __VA_ARGS__);                                \
00201   }                                                                                     \
00202   else {                                                                                \
00203     fprintf(FMB_IO_Info.f_output_data,  __VA_ARGS__);                                   \
00204   }                                                                                     \
00205 }
00206 
00207 
00208 /* The following macro has to be used ONLY when 'f_gz_data' is NOT 'FMB_IO_Info.f_input_gz_data'. */
00209 #define FMB_FSCANF_GZIP(f_data, f_gz_data, are_data_gzipped, gzgets_buffer_len, fscanf_format, ...) {           \
00210   if (are_data_gzipped){                                                                                        \
00211     char buf[gzgets_buffer_len];                                                                                \
00212     if (gzgets(f_gz_data, buf, gzgets_buffer_len) == Z_NULL){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF(); }                              \
00213     sscanf(buf, fscanf_format, __VA_ARGS__);                                                                    \
00214   }                                                                                                             \
00215   else {                                                                                                        \
00216     fscanf(f_data, fscanf_format, __VA_ARGS__);                                                                 \
00217   }                                                                                                             \
00218 }
00219 
00220 /* The following macro has to be used ONLY when 'f_gz' is NOT 'FMB_IO_Info.f_output_gz_data'. */
00221 #define FMB_FPRINTF_GZIP(f, f_gz, are_data_gzipped, ...) {                              \
00222   if (are_data_gzipped){                                                                \
00223     gzprintf(f_gz, __VA_ARGS__);                                                        \
00224   }                                                                                     \
00225   else {                                                                                \
00226     fprintf(f,  __VA_ARGS__);                                                           \
00227   }                                                                                     \
00228 }

00232 
00233 #define FMB_IO_INPUT_FSEEK(offset, whence) {                                            \
00234   if (FMB_IO_Info.are_input_data_gzipped){                                              \
00235     gzseek(FMB_IO_Info.f_input_gz_data, offset, whence);                                \
00236   }                                                                                     \
00237   else {                                                                                \
00238     fseek(FMB_IO_Info.f_input_data, offset, whence);                                    \
00239   }                                                                                     \
00240 }

00243 /*** Binary: ***/
00244 
00245 /* Reads a 'long' from input. */
00246 FMB_INLINE long FMB_IO_Fread_long(){
00247   int length = sizeof(long);
00248   long res   = 0;
00249   if (FMB_IO_Info.are_input_data_gzipped){
00250     if (gzread(FMB_IO_Info.f_input_gz_data, &res, length) < length){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF(); }
00251   }
00252   else {
00253     if (fread(&res, length /* size */, 1 /* number */, FMB_IO_Info.f_input_data) < 1){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF(); }
00254   }
00255   return (long) ntohl((unsigned long) res);
00256 }
00257 
00258 /* Writes a 'long' to output. */
00259 FMB_INLINE void FMB_IO_Fwrite_long(long l){
00260   int length = sizeof(long);
00261   long res   = (long) htonl((unsigned long) l);
00262   if (FMB_IO_Info.are_output_data_gzipped){
00263     if (gzwrite(FMB_IO_Info.f_output_gz_data, &res, length) < length){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF();}
00264   }
00265   else {
00266     if (fwrite(&res, length /* size */, 1 /* number */, FMB_IO_Info.f_output_data) < 1){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF(); }
00267   }
00268 }
00269 
00270 /* Reads an 'unsigned long' from input. */
00271 FMB_INLINE unsigned long FMB_IO_Fread_ulong(){
00272   int length = sizeof(unsigned long);
00273   unsigned long res   = 0;
00274   if (FMB_IO_Info.are_input_data_gzipped){
00275     if (gzread(FMB_IO_Info.f_input_gz_data, &res, length) < length){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF(); }
00276   }
00277   else {
00278     if (fread(&res, length /* size */, 1 /* number */, FMB_IO_Info.f_input_data) < 1){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF(); }
00279   }
00280   return ntohl(res); 
00281 }
00282 
00283 /* Writes an 'unsigned long' to output. */
00284 FMB_INLINE void FMB_IO_Fwrite_ulong(unsigned long l){
00285   int length = sizeof(unsigned long);
00286   unsigned long res   = htonl(l);
00287   if (FMB_IO_Info.are_output_data_gzipped){
00288     if (gzwrite(FMB_IO_Info.f_output_gz_data, &res, length) < length){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF();}
00289   }
00290   else {
00291     if (fwrite(&res, length /* size */, 1 /* number */, FMB_IO_Info.f_output_data) < 1){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF();}
00292   }
00293 }

00298 /* Reads a 'float' from input. */
00299 FMB_INLINE float FMB_IO_Fread_float(){
00300   int length = sizeof(float);
00301   float res  = 0.0;
00302   if (FMB_IO_Info.are_input_data_gzipped){
00303     if (gzread(FMB_IO_Info.f_input_gz_data, &res, length) < length){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF();}
00304   }
00305   else {
00306     if (fread(&res, length /* size */, 1 /* number */, FMB_IO_Info.f_input_data) < 1){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF();}
00307   }
00308   return res;
00309 }

00316   }
00317   else {
00318     if (fwrite(&f, length /* size */, 1 /* number */, FMB_IO_Info.f_output_data) < 1){ FMB_ERROR_BRIEF();}
00319   }

00357 /* Compression type used: */
00358 #define BZIP2_COMPRESSION_SUFFIX ".bz2"
00359 #define BZIP2_COMPRESSOR "bzip2"
00360 /* COMPRESSOR_LENGTH is the length of the compressor name + one white space. */
00361 #define BZIP2_COMPRESSOR_LENGTH 15 
00362 #define BZIP2_DECOMPRESSOR "bunzip2"
00363 /* DECOMPRESSOR_LENGTH is the length of the decompressor name + one white space + the COMPRESSION_SUFFIX length. */
00364 #define BZIP2_DECOMPRESSOR_LENGTH 15
00365 
00366 #define GZIP_DECOMPRESSOR_LENGTH         15
00367 #define GZIP_COMPRESSION_SUFFIX          ".gz"
00368 #define GZIP_COMPRESSION_SUFFIX_LENGTH   (strlen(GZIP_COMPRESSION_SUFFIX))
